intro: Calyptranthes izabalana, commonly known as the Izabal beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of Central America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range from white to pink in color. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and contain a single seed, making it an important food source for certain wildlife species.
